alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 30 at 8:38PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Williams in Coconino County. * WHEN...Until 1145 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. Water flowing over roadways will create slick paved roads and muddy unpaved roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 836 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in Williams, Arizona. Between 0.75 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Johnson Creek, Cataract Creek and West Cataract Creek. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.75 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Williams. - This includes the following highways... Business Interstate 40 between mile markers 163 and 164. Interstate 40 between mile markers 161 and 164. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Flooding of washes and creeks will occur, some dirt roads will become muddy and impassable. Paved roads and underpasses could become flooded as well.
